llm.feedback: Your draft mixes “Up” and “Down” signals for the same window and driver, violating the single‑direction rule; choose either a bullish or bearish view per driver, not both. Replace the generic “Fed policy cut expectation” with a concrete magnitude: e.g., “Fed cut 25 bp on 2025‑09‑16 will lift UST10Y to 4.20–4.30 % (Up) or keep it above 4.30 % if no cut (Down)”. Add the canonical handle UST10Y and the catalyst window 2025‑09‑16, citing (97MD1FHW8)(U21K4ALYQ). For the tariff risk premium, link to the handle UST10Y via the term‑premium channel, specify the 30‑bp spread and the 2025‑10‑15 tariff ruling (1DEM6P1Y2), and give a probability range (e.g., 60–70 %). Remove the duplicate “DXY trend reversal” line; instead, create a single “Down | 5‑Sept to 15‑Sept | DXY decline due to Fed pause | Fed minutes & core PCE >2.6 % | 80 % (97MD1FHW8)(FAN5RYW6T)”. Ensure each line contains a single driver, a clear causal path, a specific catalyst window, a magnitude range, and a probability, all backed by IDs. This will satisfy the handle‑mapping, catalyst, and probability requirements.
